Package Compiler.SymbolTable

Class BaseScope

java.lang.Object
Compiler.SymbolTable.BaseScope
All Implemented Interfaces:
Scope
public class BaseScope
extends java.lang.Object
implements Scope
The base implementation of the Scope interface.

    • defineSymbol

      public void defineSymbol​(Symbol symbol) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Define a symbol in the scope. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the symbol is already defined.
      Specified by:
      defineSymbol in interface Scope
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol that should be defined
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws an exception if the symbol has already been defined.

    • getSymbol

      public Symbol getSymbol​(java.lang.String name)
      Recursively gets a symbol from this scope. If not found, calls the same function in this scopes enclosing scope. Returns null if it is not found.
      Specified by:
      getSymbol in interface Scope
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the symbol that should be returned
      Returns:
      The symbol with the given name
